brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate safety and tolerability to estimate the MTD and/or recommended dose
      for expansion.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I Study of LEE011 in Asian Patients

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multi-center, open label, dose finding, phase I study of oral single agent LEE011,
      administered once daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient with a histologically confirmed diagnosis of a solid tumor

          -  ECOG PS <2

          -  Good organ function at screening visit

          -  A sufficient interval mast have elapsed between the last dose of prior anti-cancer
             therapy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Impairment of GI function

          -  Patients with concurrent severe and/or uncontrolled concurrent medical conditions

          -  Known diagnosis of HIV or active viral hepatitis

          -  Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of LEE011 in Asian Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (PMDA)

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and/or recomended dose (RD)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by incidence, duration and severity of adverse events and serious adverse events; changes in clinical laboratory values, vital signs and ECGs; tolerability of study drug (dose interruption, dose reduction)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from informed consent till 28 days after end of treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of LEE011 and PK parameters (e.g. Cmax and AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every week up to first 4 weeks, once a week in the subsequent 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: To assess preliminaly anti-tumor activity based on RECIST
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 2 months until 28 days after end of treatment
